013package org.apache.juneau.assertions;
014
015import static org.apache.juneau.internal.StringUtils.*;
016
017import java.text.*;
018import java.util.function.*;
019
020import org.apache.juneau.cp.*;
021
022/**
023 * Wrapper around a {@link Predicate} that allows for an error message for when the predicate fails.
024 *
025 * <p>
026 * Typically used wherever predicates are allowed for testing of {@link Assertion} objects such as...
027 * <ul>
028 *    <li>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#is(Predicate)}
029 *    <li>{@link FluentArrayAssertion#is(Predicate...)}
030 *    <li>{@link FluentPrimitiveArrayAssertion#is(Predicate...)}
031 *    <li>{@link FluentListAssertion#isEach(Predicate...)}
032 * </ul>
033 *
034 * <p>
035 * See {@link AssertionPredicates} for a set of predefined predicates for common use cases.
036 *
037 * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
038 * <p class='bjava'>
039 *    <jc>// Asserts that a bean passes a custom test.</jc>
040 *    <jc>// AssertionError with specified message is thrown otherwise.</jc>
041 *    Predicate&lt;MyBean&gt; <jv>predicate</jv> = <jk>new</jk> AssertionPredicate&lt;MyBean&gt;(
042 *       <jv>x</jv> -&gt; <jv>x</jv>.getFoo().equals(<js>"bar"</js>),
043 *       <js>"Foo did not equal bar.  Bean was=''{0}''"</js>,
044 *       <jsf>VALUE</jsf>
045 *    );
046 *    <jsm>assertObject</jsm>(<jv>myBean</jv>).is(<jv>predicate</jv>);
047 * </p>
048 *
049 * <ul class='seealso'>
050 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="../../../../overview-summary.html#juneau-assertions.ja.Overview">Overview &gt; juneau-assertions &gt; Overview</a>
051 * </ul>
052 *
053 * @param <T> the type of input being tested.
054 */
055public class AssertionPredicate<T> implements Predicate<T> {
056
057   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
058   // Static
059   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
060
061   /**
062    * Argument placeholder for tested value.
063    */
064   public static final Function<Object,String> VALUE = x -> stringifyDeep(x);
065
066   private static final Messages MESSAGES = Messages.of(AssertionPredicate.class, "Messages");
067   private static final String
068      MSG_valueDidNotPassTest = MESSAGES.getString("valueDidNotPassTest"),
069      MSG_valueDidNotPassTestWithValue = MESSAGES.getString("valueDidNotPassTestWithValue");
070
071   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
072   // Instance
073   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
074
075   private final Predicate<T> inner;
076   private final String message;
077   private final Object[] args;
078   final ThreadLocal<String> failedMessage = new ThreadLocal<>();
079
080   /**
081    * Constructor.
082    *
083    * @param inner The predicate test.
084    * @param message
085    *    The error message if predicate fails.
086    *    <br>Supports {@link MessageFormat}-style arguments.
087    * @param args
088    *    Optional message arguments.
089    *    <br>Can contain {@link #VALUE} to specify the value itself as an argument.
090    *    <br>Can contain {@link Function functions} to apply to the tested value.
091    */
092   public AssertionPredicate(Predicate<T> inner, String message, Object...args) {
093      this.inner = inner;
094      if (message != null) {
095         this.message = message;
096         this.args = args;
097      } else if (inner instanceof AssertionPredicate) {
098         this.message = MSG_valueDidNotPassTest;
099         this.args = new Object[]{};
100      } else {
101         this.message = MSG_valueDidNotPassTestWithValue;
102         this.args = new Object[]{VALUE};
103      }
104   }
105
106   AssertionPredicate() {
107      this.inner = null;
108      this.message = null;
109      this.args = null;
110   }
111
112   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
113   // Test methods
114   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
115
116   @Override /* Predicate */
117   @SuppressWarnings({"unchecked","rawtypes"})
118   public boolean test(T t) {
119      failedMessage.remove();
120      boolean b = inner.test(t);
121      if (! b) {
122         String m = message;
123         Object[] args = new Object[this.args.length];
124         for (int i = 0; i < args.length; i++) {
125            Object a = this.args[i];
126            if (a instanceof Function)
127               args[i] = ((Function)a).apply(t);
128            else
129               args[i] = a;
130         }
131         m = format(m, args);
132         if (inner instanceof AssertionPredicate)
133            m += "\n\t" + ((AssertionPredicate<?>)inner).getFailureMessage();
134         failedMessage.set(m);
135      }
136      return inner.test(t);
137   }
138
139   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
140   // Utility methods
141   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
142
143   /**
144    * Returns the error message from the last call to this assertion.
145    *
146    * @return The error message, or <jk>null</jk> if there was no failure.
147    */
148   protected String getFailureMessage() {
149      return failedMessage.get();
150   }
151
152   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
153   // Subclasses
154   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
155
156   /**
157    * Encapsulates multiple predicates into a single AND operation.
158    *
159    * <p>
160    * Similar to <c><jsm>stream</jsm>(<jv>predicates</jv>).reduce(<jv>x</jv>-&gt;<jk>true</jk>, Predicate::and)</c> but
161    * provides for {@link #getFailureMessage()} to return a useful message.
162    *
163    * @param <T> the type of input being tested.
164    */
165   public static class And<T> extends AssertionPredicate<T> {
166
167      private final Predicate<T>[] inner;
168
169      private static final Messages MESSAGES = Messages.of(AssertionPredicate.class, "Messages");
170      private static final String
171         MSG_predicateTestFailed = MESSAGES.getString("predicateTestFailed");
172
173      /**
174       * Constructor.
175       *
176       * @param inner The inner predicates to run.
177       */
178      @SafeVarargs
179      public And(Predicate<T>...inner) {
180         this.inner = inner;
181      }
182
183      @Override /* Predicate */
184      public boolean test(T t) {
185         failedMessage.remove();
186         for (int i = 0; i < inner.length; i++) {
187            Predicate<T> p = inner[i];
188            if (p != null) {
189               boolean b = p.test(t);
190               if (! b) {
191                  String m = format(MSG_predicateTestFailed, i+1);
192                  if (p instanceof AssertionPredicate)
193                     m += "\n\t" + ((AssertionPredicate<?>)p).getFailureMessage();
194                  failedMessage.set(m);
195                  return false;
196               }
197            }
198         }
199         return true;
200      }
201   }
202
203   /**
204    * Encapsulates multiple predicates into a single OR operation.
205    *
206    * <p>
207    * Similar to <c><jsm>stream</jsm>(<jv>predicates</jv>).reduce(<jv>x</jv>-&gt;<jk>true</jk>, Predicate::or)</c> but
208    * provides for {@link #getFailureMessage()} to return a useful message.
209    *
210    * @param <T> the type of input being tested.
211    */
212   public static class Or<T> extends AssertionPredicate<T> {
213
214      private static final Messages MESSAGES = Messages.of(AssertionPredicate.class, "Messages");
215      private static final String
216         MSG_noPredicateTestsPassed = MESSAGES.getString("noPredicateTestsPassed");
217
218      private final Predicate<T>[] inner;
219
220      /**
221       * Constructor.
222       *
223       * @param inner The inner predicates to run.
224       */
225      @SafeVarargs
226      public Or(Predicate<T>...inner) {
227         this.inner = inner;
228      }
229
230      @Override /* Predicate */
231      public boolean test(T t) {
232         failedMessage.remove();
233         for (Predicate<T> p : inner)
234            if (p != null)
235               if (p.test(t))
236                  return true;
237         String m = format(MSG_noPredicateTestsPassed);
238         failedMessage.set(m);
239         return false;
240      }
241   }
242
243   /**
244    * Negates an assertion.
245    *
246    * <p>
247    * Similar to <c><jv>predicate</jv>.negate()</c> but provides for {@link #getFailureMessage()} to return a useful message.
248    *
249    * @param <T> the type of input being tested.
250    */
251   public static class Not<T> extends AssertionPredicate<T> {
252
253      private static final Messages MESSAGES = Messages.of(AssertionPredicate.class, "Messages");
254      private static final String
255         MSG_predicateTestsUnexpectedlyPassed = MESSAGES.getString("predicateTestsUnexpectedlyPassed");
256
257      private final Predicate<T> inner;
258
259      /**
260       * Constructor.
261       *
262       * @param inner The inner predicates to run.
263       */
264      public Not(Predicate<T> inner) {
265         this.inner = inner;
266      }
267
268      @Override /* Predicate */
269      public boolean test(T t) {
270         failedMessage.remove();
271         Predicate<T> p = inner;
272         if (p != null) {
273            boolean b = p.test(t);
274            if (b) {
275               failedMessage.set(format(MSG_predicateTestsUnexpectedlyPassed));
276               return false;
277            }
278         }
279         return true;
280      }
281   }
282}
